page.title: 01HORNCHURCH AND UPMINSTER
page.content: Hornchurch and Upminster are pleasant residential areas on the outskirts of London. They have tube and mainline stations which are convenient for people who commute to work. Many streets are lined with trees. Housing areas are separated by parks and open spaces. Dwellings are detached, semi-detached, terraced or bungalows. There are small blocks of flats which are two, three or more stories high. Some have been built during the 1930's and some quite recently. The houses are quite expensive especially if they are near a station. Nearly all the houses are owner-occupied. Hornchurch was once the larger town with a cattle market and agricultural functions. Today both are part of the London conurbation.
